section.title: Events
section.para: Events represent's MAP's common services as well as services related to USSD Events are fired on MAPDialog

important.para: For proper render of this table prefixes, for entries on some columns are ommited. For prefix values, for each column, please see list below:
Version for all defined events is 1.0
Vendor for all defined events is org.mobicents
Spaces where introduced in Name column values, to correctly render the table. Please remove them when using copy/paste.

row.entry: Indicates end of MAP commands that triggered other events to be fired.
Generic event representing ANY map request. This event is fired for ALL incoming requests.
Indicates that remote peer acknowledged dialog. This event is fired prior to any other event in such case.
Opposite to DIALOG_ACCEPT. Indicates that remote peer rejected dialog for some reason. This event is fired prior to one indicating reason.
Fired when remote MAP user aborts dialog.
Fired when when dialog is aborted due to transport level error.
Fired when dialog is closed via TCAP-END primitive.
Fired when abnormal message is received within dialog. For instance when when duplicated InvokeID or wrong operation is received(for running MAP service).
Fired when dialog is about to timeout. Depending on configuration RA may sustain dialog or let it timeout. This event is fired when there is no activity on dialog for extended period of time.

important.para: For proper render of this table prefixes, for entries on some columns are ommited. For prefix values, for each column, please see list below:
Version for all defined events is 1.0
Vendor for all defined events is org.mobicents
Spaces where introduced in Name column values, to correctly render the table. Please remove them when using copy/paste.

row.entry: Fired when initial USSD request is received.
Fired for each subsequent USSD request.

important.para: For proper render of this table prefixes, for entries on some columns are ommited. For prefix values, for each column, please see list below:
Version for all defined events is 1.0
Vendor for all defined events is org.mobicents
Spaces where introduced in Name column values, to correctly render the table. Please remove them when using copy/paste.

row.entry: Fired when localy initiated Invoke does not receive any answer for extended period of time.
Fired when remote peer indicates abnormal component. It indicates some protocol error in component sent from local peer.
Fired when transport provider encounters error on parsing MAP message. It is similar in meaning to ERROR_COMPONENT, but for component received from remote peer.
Fired when remote end rejects component for some reason.
